Notes: Lithuanian language (lt) notes from Xenobius2501
en: a word ending with “-an” makes it mean “of Fedimia”
Dojo is often used for a melee training hall
Obsolete - Korean map name was changed
lit. mercenary request-location
ko: actually lit. Mine Village
green-gemstone
avoid possible copyright issue
ko: I have no idea. It says Moo Moo Plateau.
lt: lt possessive case for name, Ruklys - en: fancy alliteration
lt: veja means grass lawn.
lt: vieta means place, not much sense here at all.
lt: septyni is a numerical, seven. Septyntas = Seventh Glen OR Septyniu = Glen of the Seven
lt: Karolis is a person's name, possessive form
lt: paupys means riverside, so it's a riverside port.
lt: poslinkis is a slip, so perhaps a slipping forest?

New-Ensata: Saknies / Sakniu Plains - sg. vs pl.
Notes: lt: saknis means root,  Great Root Plain - duplicate?
lt: sirdgela is heartache,  name is okay-ish, except correct case would be Sirdgelos.
lt: Stupid Forest. Literally. If Fool's Forest was intended it had to be Kvailio Forest.

New-Ensata: Dvasios / Dvasiu Peak - sg. vs pl.
Notes: lt: Peak of Souls or Soul's Peak

New-Ensata: Ramscio / Ramsciu Ridge  - sg. vs pl.
Notes: lt: Pillar Ridge
lt: Stone's Ridge.  possessive form is used correctly,
lt: Bridge Valley. Overlong Bridge Valley - duplicate?
lt: Rukas means mist. Dense Mist Plateau - duplicate?
lt: Bad phonetics - lt word ieškančių - possessive case, means Seekers . pronounced like Yesh-kan-chuu
lt: to pretend - Apsimetinejimo means “of pretending”, Apsimetes means “Pretending”
lt: Need more info - “vilna” means wool, so “Vilnos Forest” OR “Vilnia” was a river name, so “Vilnios Forest”
lt: “to cry” — crying = “Verkiantis Square” OR “square of cries” = “Verksmu Square”

English: Fortress Battle Field of the earth

Notes: lt: makes no sense; lit. “Devotion Exile” — “Devotee's Exile” = “Atsidavelio Exile” OR “Saint's Exile” = “Sventojo Exile”
lt: “Prison”
lt: “Pure” as in “uncontaminated”, or slang for “Cash”; spiritual purity is “Tyras”
plural is “Griny” or “Tyrus”
